intro: Stachytarpheta gesnerioides var. rotundata, commonly known as the round-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in warm climates.
